intro: Echidnopsis radians, commonly known as the star-shaped rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Echidnopsis radians is a low-growing succulent, often forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion.
